qas.question: What resulted in effective and long-term isolation of Jewish communities?

answers.text: An array of Jewish communities was established by Jewish settlers in various places around the Old World, often at great distances from one another

qas.question: Name one way Jewish cultural expressions differ in each community?
Name another way Jewish cultural expressions differ in each community?
What did not cause ethnic divisions between Jews?
Where did Jewish people not settle?
What is one way Jewish cultural expressions stayed the same in each community?
What is another way Jewish cultural expressions stayed the same in each community?

plausible_answers.text: During the millennia of the Jewish diaspora

qas.question: At what time did Jewish communities not develop under the influence of their local environments?

context: Within the world's Jewish population there are distinct ethnic divisions, most of which are primarily the result of <b3_0>geographic branching<b3_0/> from an originating Israelite population, and subsequent independent evolutions. <a0_0>An array of Jewish communities was established by Jewish settlers in various places around <b4_0>the Old World<b4_0/>, often at great distances from one another<a0_0/>, resulting in effective and often long-term isolation. <b7_0>During the millennia of the Jewish diaspora<b7_0/> the communities would develop under the influence of their local environments: political, cultural, natural, and populational. Today, manifestations of these differences among the Jews can be observed in Jewish cultural expressions of each community, including Jewish linguistic diversity, <a2_0><b5_0>culinary preferences<b5_0/><a2_0/>, liturgical practices, <a1_0><b6_0>religious interpretations<b6_0/><a1_0/>, as well as degrees and sources of genetic admixture.
